intro: Ectozoma pavonii, commonly known as the pavonii orchid, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that resemble butterflies. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its botanical features include long, slender stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are usually fragrant and bloom during the warmer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
